Package cpsc2150.extendedCheckers.models

Interface ICheckerBoard

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbsCheckerBoard, CheckerBoard, CheckerBoardMem
public interface ICheckerBoard
ICheckerBoard is an interface that contains methods for managing and run the game checkers. It manages how the pieces interact with each other and move around the board. This interface contains primary actions that can be performed on a checkerboard.

      • Constant Field Values

  • Method Details

    • getViableDirections

      HashMap<Character,ArrayList<DirectionEnum>> getViableDirections()
      Retrieves a mapping of pieces to their viable movement direction
      Returns:
      A hashmap where the key is a character representing a piece type [Player One] or [Player Two] and the value is a list of possible directions that the piece can move

    • getPieceCounts

      HashMap<Character,Integer> getPieceCounts()
      Retrieves the count of each type of piece currently on the board
      Returns:
      A hashmap where each key is a character representing a piece type and each corresponding value is an integer count of pieces of that type

    • getRowNum

      int getRowNum()
      Retrieves the number of rows
      Returns:
      An int that represents the number of rows on the game board

    • getColNum

      int getColNum()
      Retrieves the number of columns
      Returns:
      An int that represents the number of columns on the game board

    • placePiece

      void placePiece(BoardPosition pos, char player)
      Places a piece on the board at the specified position
      Parameters:
      pos - The BoardPosition where the piece will be placed
      player - A character representing the player piece to be placed

    • whatsAtPos

      char whatsAtPos(BoardPosition pos)
      Checks what piece is at the specific board position
      Parameters:
      pos - The BoardPosition to be checked
      Returns:
      A character representing the piece of the specified position, or a default character if the position is empty

    • checkPlayerWin

      default boolean checkPlayerWin(Character player)
      Checks if the specified player has won the game. A player only wins if the opponent has no remaining pieces on the board.
      Parameters:
      player - , The player character [PLAYER_ONE or PLAYER_TWO] whose win status is to be checked. PLAYER_ONE represents one player and PLAYER_TWO represents the opponent
      Returns:
      true if the specified player has won otherwise it is false

    • crownPiece

      default void crownPiece(BoardPosition posOfPlayer)
      Crowns the piece at the specific board position and promotes it to a "king" piece or "crowned" by changing it to upper case
      Parameters:
      posOfPlayer - The position on the board where the player's piece to be crowned is located.

    • movePiece

      default BoardPosition movePiece(BoardPosition startingPos, DirectionEnum dir)
      Moves the piece from the starting position in the specific direction by one space
      Parameters:
      startingPos - The current position of the piece to be moved
      dir - The direction in which to move the piece
      Returns:
      The new position of the piece after moving one space in the specified direction.

    • jumpPiece

      default BoardPosition jumpPiece(BoardPosition startingPos, DirectionEnum dir)
      Jumps the piece from the starting position over another piece in the specific direction
      Parameters:
      startingPos - the current position of the piece to be jumped
      dir - the direction in which to jump the piece
      Returns:
      the new position of the piece after jumping over another piece in the specified direction

    • scanSurroundingPositions

      default HashMap<DirectionEnum,Character> scanSurroundingPositions(BoardPosition startingPos)
      Scans the surrounding positions around the starting position
      Parameters:
      startingPos - the position from which to scan surrounding positions
      Returns:
      a map where each key is a direction and each value is the character present at that position in the specific direction

    • getDirection

      static BoardPosition getDirection(DirectionEnum dir)
      Turns dir into a corresponding board position
      Parameters:
      dir - a direction that a piece can be moved
      Returns:
      a board representation of the corresponding direction
